## Exercise #1

Using the iris data set in base R (i.e. you already have access to it in your environment), show two different ways to grab the first 10 rows.

```{r eval=FALSE}
iris[1:10,]
head(iris, 10)
```

## Exercise #2

Using the iris data set in base R,  show two different ways to grab the first two columns (bonus if you can show three).

```{r eval=FALSE}
iris[,1:2]
iris[c('Sepal.Length', 'Sepal.Width')]
iris[,c('Sepal.Length', 'Sepal.Width')]
```
